org.opendaylight.controller.cluster.datastore

Class TransactionChainProxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opendaylight.controller.cluster.datastore.TransactionChainProxy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, DOMStoreTransactionChain, DOMStoreTransactionFactory

    public class TransactionChainProxy
extends java.lang.Object
implements DOMStoreTransactionChain
    TransactionChainProxy acts as a proxy for a DOMStoreTransactionChain created on a remote shard

    • Method Detail

      • getTransactionChainId

        public java.lang.String getTransactionChainId()

      • newReadOnlyTransaction

        public DOMStoreReadTransaction newReadOnlyTransaction()
        Description copied from interface: DOMStoreTransactionChain
        Create a new read only transaction which will continue the chain. The previous write transaction has to be either READY or CANCELLED. If previous write transaction was already commited to data store, new read-only transaction is same as obtained via DOMStoreTransactionFactory.newReadOnlyTransaction() and contains merged result of previous one and current state of data store. Otherwise read-only transaction presents isolated view as if previous read-write transaction was successful. State which was introduced by other transactions outside this transaction chain after creation of previous transaction is not visible.
        Specified by:
        newReadOnlyTransaction in interface DOMStoreTransactionChain
        Specified by:
        newReadOnlyTransaction in interface DOMStoreTransactionFactory
        Returns:
        New transaction in the chain.

      • newReadWriteTransaction

        public DOMStoreReadWriteTransaction newReadWriteTransaction()
        Description copied from interface: DOMStoreTransactionChain
        Create a new read write transaction which will continue the chain. The previous read-write transaction has to be either COMMITED or CANCELLED. If previous write transaction was already commited to data store, new read-write transaction is same as obtained via DOMStoreTransactionFactory.newReadWriteTransaction() and contains merged result of previous one and current state of data store. Otherwise read-write transaction presents isolated view as if previous read-write transaction was successful. State which was introduced by other transactions outside this transaction chain after creation of previous transaction is not visible.
        Specified by:
        newReadWriteTransaction in interface DOMStoreTransactionChain
        Specified by:
        newReadWriteTransaction in interface DOMStoreTransactionFactory
        Returns:
        New transaction in the chain.

      • newWriteOnlyTransaction

        public DOMStoreWriteTransaction newWriteOnlyTransaction()
        Description copied from interface: DOMStoreTransactionChain
        Create a new write-only transaction which will continue the chain. The previous read-write transaction has to be either READY or CANCELLED.
        Specified by:
        newWriteOnlyTransaction in interface DOMStoreTransactionChain
        Specified by:
        newWriteOnlyTransaction in interface DOMStoreTransactionFactory
        Returns:
        New transaction in the chain.

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: DOMStoreTransactionChain
        Closes Transaction Chain. Close method of transaction chain does not guarantee that last alocated transaction is ready or was submitted.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface DOMStoreTransactionChain
